intro: Lachnocaulon minus, commonly known as the small lachnocaulon, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features a short, upright stem with numerous small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Lachnocaulon minus is often found in woodland areas and is noted for its delicate appearance and ecological significance.
